descriptionNullable:
### Context

I really wanted to run some statistical correlations on boardgames and their mechanics, so I scraped this data. I hope it helps others!


### Content

Data was acquired by scraping the BoardGameGeek XML API at all boardgame entry endpoints. Finished acquiring data on 7/15/2020. XML files in raw_data represent the raw endpoints, while the CSVs are distillations of that data for users' convenience.

* basic_data.csv - basic stats on all boardgames in the database
* categories_data.csv - what categories do games belong to, and what are their BGG scores?
* mechanics_data.csv - what game mechanics do games use, and what are their BGG scores?
* subdomain_data.csv - what broad BGG categories do games fall under (e.g. Strategy Games, Party Games, etc.) and what are their BGG scores?

### Acknowledgements

Thanks to BGG for providing the XML API that made this possible, as well as to [mrpantherson ](https://www.kaggle.com/mrpantherson)whose original BGG dataset of the top 5,000 games inspired this effort. And thanks to the many users that powered this data by providing scores, tagging mechanics, etc.!

### Inspiration

I'd love to get a better understanding of the correlations between various game attributes and how they are rated on BGG. It might also be fun to correlate with the "owned" property to get a rough measure of what qualities in games drive sales (at least among the BGG community).
title: bgg-games-data
subtitle: Data for 286,000+ Board Games
description:
### Context

I really wanted to run some statistical correlations on boardgames and their mechanics, so I scraped this data. I hope it helps others!


### Content

Data was acquired by scraping the BoardGameGeek XML API at all boardgame entry endpoints. Finished acquiring data on 7/15/2020. XML files in raw_data represent the raw endpoints, while the CSVs are distillations of that data for users' convenience.

* basic_data.csv - basic stats on all boardgames in the database
* categories_data.csv - what categories do games belong to, and what are their BGG scores?
* mechanics_data.csv - what game mechanics do games use, and what are their BGG scores?
* subdomain_data.csv - what broad BGG categories do games fall under (e.g. Strategy Games, Party Games, etc.) and what are their BGG scores?

### Acknowledgements

Thanks to BGG for providing the XML API that made this possible, as well as to [mrpantherson ](https://www.kaggle.com/mrpantherson)whose original BGG dataset of the top 5,000 games inspired this effort. And thanks to the many users that powered this data by providing scores, tagging mechanics, etc.!

### Inspiration

I'd love to get a better understanding of the correlations between various game attributes and how they are rated on BGG. It might also be fun to correlate with the "owned" property to get a rough measure of what qualities in games drive sales (at least among the BGG community).
